answers.author: Ali Miller Richards
answers.text:
Of all U.S. ICMA members working for local government in professional positions (regardless of job title), 24% are female as of June 2.
The ICMA State of the Profession Survey is conducted every few years and provides a snapshot of U.S. Chief Administrative Officer demographics (job-title specific, members and non-members). In 2000, 12.1% of respondents were female; in 2002, 12.5%; in 2006, 22.9%; and in 2009, 20.1%. You can learn more about the State of the Profession Survey instrument and response rates, and view aggregate results online at http://icma.org/en/results/surveying/survey_research/survey_results.

text: What percentage of local government management professionals are female?
title: women in the profession
